_exec_summary.SummaryText:
MORNINGSTAR FOODS
CITY OF INDUSTRY - NORTH
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND
PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
Anhydrous Ammonia Refrigeration System

Revised June 2004

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Dean Foods Corporation is a leading manufacturer and distributor of fresh milk and related dairy products, shelf stable and refrigerated foods and beverage product, frozen food product, coffee and plastic containers.  The company products are distributed throughout the United States.  Morningstar Foods (Morningstar) is a subsidiary of Dean Foods Corporation.

Morningstar City of Industry-North Facility prepared a Chemical Risk Management Program and Process Safety Management Program (RMP/PSM) in general accordance with state and federal regulations.  The state risk management regulations, also referred to as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) program, are codified in California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 19, Section 2735.1, et. Seq.  The Federal Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) also regulates facilities with certain toxic and flammable substances.  The regulations are codified in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR), Part 68.  Finally, both the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Association (OSHA) and the California Occupational Safety and Health Association (CalOSHA) regulate facilities with certain acutely hazardous materials under the PSM regulations, as defined in CCR Title 8, Section 5189 and CFR Title 29, Part 1910, Section 119, respectively.

Morningstar prepared the RMP/CalARP/PSM to satisfy regulatory requirements and to demonstrate a commitment to evaluate and improve anhydrous ammonia handling systems and practices at the facility.  Morningstar incorporated many state of the art safety features into the ammonia refrigeration system at the facility as part of the original system construction and subsequent system modifications.  Morningstar will continue to improve ammonia-handling safety through the implementation of the preventi

on program elements of the RMP/CalARP/PSM.  In the unlikely event that a chemical release does occur at the facility, Morningstar personnel are trained in the appropriate evacuation procedures and will work closely with the county fire department haz-mat response team.

The City of Industry-North Facility is located at 18275 Arenth Avenue, City of Industry, cA 91748.  The surrounding area primarily consists of industrial and commercial businesses.

The facility was expanded in early 2000s.  As a result of this building expansion, the facility?s ammonia refrigeration system was also expanded.  The new system is a closed cycle heat exchange system.  It adds approximately 21,362 pounds of recirculated ammonia to the existing refrigeration, which contains approximately 4,400 pounds of ammonia.

Operations at the facility consist of the storage, processing, packaging, and distribution of dairy products.  The facility typically operates 24 hours per day, 365 days per year.

Anhydrous ammonia is used in the refrigeration system at the facility.  The overall refrigeration system contains approximately 25,762 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  The system provides cooling for production areas, product and water chilling.  The desired temperatures are maintained by controlling the flow of ammonia with manually and electrically operated valves, float switches, and compressor controls.

The RPM/CalARP/PSM regulations require a review of the five-year accident history at a regulated facility.  This facility reported no accidental releases of ammonia within the past five years.

The RPM/CalARP/PSM regulations require a review of the accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps used by the facility.  Many safety features have been incorporated into the ammonia refrigeration system to prevent system failures and to mitigate potential releases.  The safety features include but not limited to the following:

? emergency shutdown systems
? pressure relief val

ves on vessels and compressors.
? Engine room is equipped with ammonia detection system and ventilation system
? Many of the ammonia pipes, valves and components are labeled
? A fire sprinkler system is installed in the plant.

In addition to the physical features of the ammonia refrigeration system at the facility, Morningstar has extensive administrative controls in place to maintain safe operation of the system.  Administrative controls include, but are not limited to, training programs for system operators and mechanics, emergency training, a hot work permit program, a lockout/tagout program, a contractor safety program, incident investigation program, mechanical integrity and inspection program. 

Morningstar recognizes that the RMP/CalARP/PSM program is a continuous process for evaluating, monitoring, and improving anhydrous ammonia handling operations at its facility.  As such, this document, related attachments, and program elements will evolve as Morningstar continues their ongoing focus and dedication of risk minimization and safety improvement for their employees and surrounding community.   Morningstar will submit revised information if a change occurs that is considered significant and requires resubmission under the regulations.  However, minor improvements/modifications to the RMP/CalARP/PSM, related attachments, and program elements will be incorporated consistent with Morningstar?s internal review practices, and Morningstar will maintain the most current versions on site.  Thus, the most current version of the RMP/CalARP/PSM Program and related documents and elements maintained on site may vary slightly from the information in submittals made to EPA and other regulatory agencies.
